text: Yeshiva University is a Jewish private university in New York City. It has six campuses in New York City and one in Israel. The university was founded in 1886. It is a research university. Its campuses and schools include Yeshiva College, Stern College for Women, Syms School of Business, Albert Einstein College of Medicine and the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in New York City Category:1886 establishments in the United States Category:1880s establishments in New York (state)
title: Yeshiva University
